vocabulary.definition: Used to connect words, phrases, or clauses of equal grammatical rank.

examples.tausug: In babai iban in usug naghihinang.
examples.english: The woman and the man are working.

examples.tausug: Siya iban aku madtu pa bay.
examples.english: He/she and I will go home.
Food and drink are needed.

vocabulary.notes: Used to join nouns, pronouns, and phrases.

examples.tausug: Kape atawa tsa, inu in iban mu?
examples.english: Coffee or tea, which do you want?
Will you go now or tomorrow?

vocabulary.definition: Used to introduce a contrast or exception.

examples.tausug: Mabaya' aku madtu, kata masakit aku.
examples.english: I want to go, but I am sick.
The food is good, but expensive.

examples.tausug: Di' aku makatū sabab masakit in bukun ku.
examples.english: I cannot come because my body aches.
He ran because it was about to rain.
I am happy because you are here.

examples.tausug: Kākun kaw magkaun, wayruun madtu pa iskul.
examples.english: If you eat, then go to school.

examples.tausug: Kākun matapus aku, tawagan ta kaw.
examples.english: If I finish, I will call you.
If there is time, we will go.

vocabulary.definition: Used to indicate time or condition.

examples.english: When he arrives, tell him.

examples.tausug: Bang may kwarta aku, bumili aku.
examples.english: If I have money, I will buy.

vocabulary.notes: Can mean either 'when' or 'if' depending on context.

examples.english: Because of him/her, I couldn't come.

vocabulary.notes: Similar to sabab but often used with nouns.

examples.english: Even if it rains, I will go.
Even if expensive, I will buy it.

vocabulary.definition: In spite of the fact that.

examples.english: Although he is sick, he still worked.
I will wait until he arrives.
As long as there is day, there is hope.
He studied, therefore he passed.
I read in order to understand.

vocabulary.definition: Words that connect words, phrases, or clauses in Tausug.

examples.english: Iban (and) - adds information
Atawa (or) - gives choice
Kata (but) - shows contrast
Sabab (because) - gives reason

vocabulary.notes: Conjunctions are essential for forming complex sentences in Tausug.
